headline: Disney+ Churn Rate: The One Number That Shows If Streaming Is Working
summary: Disney doesn’t report Disney+ churn rates. That silence tells you everything. While Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) doesn’t publicly disclose specific monthly churn figures, Walt Disney (NYSE:DIS) won’t disclose the number at all. Here’s why it matters: churn reveals whether you’re building a library people keep paying for or a content treadmill they hop on and off. The ... Disney+ Churn Rate: The One Number That Shows If Streaming Is Working

headline: Will Netflix Go All-Cash for WBD?
summary: Netflix may be forced to offer all cash for WBD if the cable assets being spun off don't have the value Netflix thought they did. But is that something Netflix will do, and what are the risks?

headline: Netflix Nosedive: Is NFLX Stock a Bargain With 60% Upside or a Trap?
summary: The Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) sell-off has carried into the new year, with shares down 7% year to date or close to 37% from all-time highs hit back in June 2025. Undoubtedly, the bearish moment for Netflix feels worse than it is, especially when you consider that shares were pretty much going parabolic in the first half ... Netflix Nosedive: Is NFLX Stock a Bargain With 60% Upside or a Trap?

headline: The Melania Movie Looks Like a Box-Office Flop. What It Means for Amazon.
summary: When it comes to the streaming wars, investors have tended to see  Amazon.com  as an afterthought.  The company’s new documentary about Melania Trump looks unlikely to change that.  At first glance, that’s a solid-enough opening weekend for a documentary—but it pales in comparison to what Amazon has spent on “Melania.”

headline: Netflix’s $82.7b Warner Bros. Bid Tests Valuation, Growth And Deal Risks
summary: Netflix has announced an $82.7b all cash bid to acquire Warner Bros. Discovery, the largest media deal in its history. The proposed transaction comes during active regulatory scrutiny in the US and UK and competing interest from other bidders, including Paramount Skydance. The deal is intended to expand Netflix's content library and competitive position while raising questions about media consolidation. Netflix, listed as NasdaqGS:NFLX, is moving forward with this proposed acquisition while...
